subject: Re: [junit] How to test a bussiness method returns a enumeration
msgSnippet: It is somewhat challenging to write test cases for list methods from a persistence store (RDBMS or LDAP server).  The key to doing this successfully is to have
messageBody:
It is somewhat challenging to write test cases for list methods from a persistence store (RDBMS or LDAP server). The
key to doing this successfully is to have a small set of test data that is consistent (50 customer profiles for example)

Assuming that the data is going to be mapped to Java objects, you could hard code the objects against the known test
data; however, this would be tedious. A better approach is to write a small worker class that will get the data,
instantiate the objects, display the data within the objects, and then serialize the object. This procedure requires a
detailed manual check of the contents of the object. Once you are confident the serialized objects contain the correct
data you can conveniently use these objects for further testing.

Mike



Pendyala Lakshmana wrote:

> Hi All

> We are trying to use Junit for unit testing of ejbs. If the business
